decoworld.model.world

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.world.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    A data model for a singular World, containing a Map and a collection of Items and Entities.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(Id<World> worldId, Map map)
      Initialises a new World instance with the specified Id and Map.

        map - the Map to use.

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int x,
           int y)
        Returns a Tile of the underlying Map at the specified location. This will return the same tile object if two positions have the same type of tile.
        Parameters:
        x - The zero-based x-coordinate.
        y - The zero-based y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        the Tile at the specified position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if x or y parameters are invalid given the map bounds.

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(WorldItem item)
        Deprecated. 
        Removes the specified item from this World's list of items. If the item does not exist, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        item - the entity to remove

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity(WorldEntity entity)
        Removes the specified entity from this World's list of entities. If the entity does not exist, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to remove

      • removeItems

        public <T extends WorldItem> void removeItems(java.util.Collection<T> items)
        Removes the specified collection of items from this World's list of items. If any of the specified items do not exist, it is skipped.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a generic type that must be a child of WorldItem.
        Parameters:
        items - the collection of items to remove.

      • removeEntities

        public <T extends WorldEntity> void removeEntities(java.util.Collection<T> entities)
        Removes the specified collection of entities from this World's list of entities. If any of the specified entities do not exist, it is skipped.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a generic type that must be a child of WorldEntity
        Parameters:
        entities - the collection of entities to remove.
